title: Amundsen vs Unstructured: Which data governance Tool is Better in 2026?
metaDescription: Compare Amundsen vs Unstructured. See pricing, features, pros & cons to choose the best data governance tool for your needs in 2026.
introduction: Choosing between Amundsen and Unstructured for your data governance needs? Both are popular tools in the AI space, but they have different strengths, pricing models, and use cases. This comprehensive comparison breaks down the key differences to help you make an informed decision.

sections.title: Overview: Amundsen vs Unstructured
paragraphs: Amundsen is Amundsen is an open-source data discovery and metadata engine originally developed by Lyft. It provides a centralized search and catalog interface for data assets (tables, dashboards, streams) across an organization, enabling users to find, understand, and trust data. Its key capabilities include automated metadata ingestion, data lineage visualization, and usage-driven ranking, uniquely focusing on improving data productivity and reducing time spent searching for data.. It's known for data-catalog, metadata-management, data-lineage.

Unstructured, on the other hand, is Unstructured is an open-source library and API platform for ingesting and pre-processing documents and images into clean, structured data for AI applications. It specializes in extracting text, tables, and metadata from hundreds of file formats (PDFs, PPTX, HTML, emails, images) and chunking content for optimal use with LLMs and RAG systems. Its unique value lies in its battle-tested, production-ready connectors and its ability to handle complex, real-world document layouts where other tools fail.. Users choose it for document-ingestion, rag-preprocessing, pdf-parsing.

sections.title: Pricing Comparison
paragraphs: When it comes to value for money, consider your specific use case and team size.

sections.title: Features & Capabilities
paragraphs: Amundsen excels in: Automated metadata ingestion from sources like Apache Atlas, AWS Glue, and databases, Search interface with ranking based on usage patterns (e.g., frequent queries, popularity), Column-level lineage tracking to visualize data flow and dependencies. This makes it ideal for teams that need data-catalog.

Unstructured stands out with: Pre-built connectors for 50+ sources (S3, Google Drive, SharePoint, Azure, etc.), Native support for 100+ file types (PDF, DOCX, PPTX, JPG, PNG, HTML, Emails), Intelligent document partitioning and chunking strategies for LLM context windows. It's particularly strong for users focused on document-ingestion.

sections.title: Use Cases: When to Choose Each Tool
paragraphs: Choose Amundsen if: You need data-catalog, work with metadata-management, or require flexible pricing.
Choose Unstructured if: You prioritize document-ingestion, work in rag-preprocessing, or prefer their pricing model.

sections.title: Pros & Cons
paragraphs: Amundsen Pros: Verified platform, Highly rated (4.4/5), Extensive feature set.
Amundsen Cons: Some limitations on free tier.
Unstructured Pros: Verified platform, Highly rated (4.4/5), Comprehensive features.
Unstructured Cons: May have feature limitations.

verdict: Both Amundsen and Unstructured are solid choices for data governance. Your choice depends on your specific requirements: Amundsen is better for data-catalog, while Unstructured excels at document-ingestion. Consider trying both with their free tiers or trials to see which fits your workflow better.
